name: show
desc: Whether to show the `timeline` component. It would not show with a setting of `false`, but its functions still remain.

name: type
desc: This attribute has only one valid value as `slider` by now. You don't have to change it.

name: axisType
desc:
Type of axis, whose values may be:

+ `'value'`
Numeric axis, which is suitable for continuous data.
+ `'category'`
Category axis, which is suitable for category data.
+ `'time'`
Time axis, which is suitable for continuous time data. Compared with value axis, time axis is equipped with time formatting function and has a different method when calculating axis ticks. For example, for time axis, axis ticks may vary in choosing unit as month, week, date, or hour based on the range of data.

name: currentIndex
desc: Indicates which is the currently selected item. For instance, if `currentIndex` is `0`, it indicates that the currently selected item is `timeline.data[0]` (namely, using `options[0]`).

name: autoPlay
desc: Whether to play automatically.

name: rewind
desc: Whether supports playing reversely.

name: loop
desc: Whether to loop playing.

name: playInterval
desc: Indicates play speed (gap time between two state), whose unit is millisecond.

name: realtime
desc: Whether the view updates in real time during dragging the control dot.

name: controlPosition
desc: Position of the play button, whose valid values are `'left'` and `'right'`.

name: zlevel
desc:
`zlevel` value of all graphical elements in .

`zlevel` is used to make layers with Canvas. Graphical elements with different `zlevel` values will be placed in different Canvases, which is a common optimization technique. We can put those frequently changed elements (like those with animations) to a separate `zlevel`. Notice that too many Canvases will increase memory cost, and should be used carefully on mobile phones to avoid crash.

Canvases with bigger `zlevel` will be placed on Canvases with smaller `zlevel`.

name: z
desc:
`z` value of all graphical elements in , which controls order of drawing graphical components. Components with smaller `z` values may be overwritten by those with larger `z` values.

`z` has a lower priority to `zlevel`, and will not create new Canvas.

name: left
desc:
Distance between timeline component and the left side of the container.

`left` value can be instant pixel value like `20`; it can also be a percentage value relative to container width like `'20%'`; and it can also be `'left'`, `'center'`, or `'right'`.

If the `left` value is set to be `'left'`, `'center'`, or `'right'`, then the component will be aligned automatically based on position.

name: top
desc:
Distance between timeline component and the top side of the container.

`top` value can be instant pixel value like `20`; it can also be a percentage value relative to container width like `'20%'`; and it can also be `'top'`, `'middle'`, or `'bottom'`.

If the `left` value is set to be `'top'`, `'middle'`, or `'bottom'`, then the component will be aligned automatically based on position.

name: right
desc:
Distance between timeline component and the right side of the container.

`right` value can be instant pixel value like `20`; it can also be a percentage value relative to container width like `'20%'`.

Adaptive by default.

name: bottom
desc:
Distance between timeline component and the bottom side of the container.

`bottom` value can be instant pixel value like `20`; it can also be a percentage value relative to container width like `'20%'`.

Adaptive by default.

name: padding
desc:
timeline space around content. The unit is px. Default values for each position are 5. And they can be set to different values with left, right, top, and bottom.

Examples:
```js
// Set padding to be 5
padding: 5
// Set the top and bottom paddings to be 5, and left and right paddings to be 10
padding: [5, 10]
// Set each of the four paddings seperately
padding: [
5,  // up
10, // right
5,  // down
10, // left
]
```

name: orient
desc:
Orientation of the component, whose valid values are:

+ `'vertical'`: vertical layout.
+ `'horizontal'`: horizontal layout.

name: inverse
desc: + Whether to put the `timeline` component reversely, which makes the elements in the front to be at the end.

name: symbol
desc:
Symbol of timeline.



Icon types provided by ECharts includes
`'circle'`, `'rect'`, `'roundRect'`, `'triangle'`, `'diamond'`, `'pin'`, `'arrow'`, `'none'`






It can be set to an image with `'image://url'` , in which URL is the link to an image, or `dataURI` of an image.


An image URL example:

```
'image://http://xxx.xxx.xxx/a/b.png'
```

A `dataURI` example:

```
'image://data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhEAAQAMQAAORHHOVSKudfOulrSOp3WOyDZu6QdvCchPGolfO0o/XBs/fNwfjZ0frl3/zy7////wAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAACH5BAkAABAALAAAAAAQABAAAAVVICSOZGlCQAosJ6mu7fiyZeKqNKToQGDsM8hBADgUXoGAiqhSvp5QAnQKGIgUhwFUYLCVDFCrKUE1lBavAViFIDlTImbKC5Gm2hB0SlBCBMQiB0UjIQA7'
```


Icons can be set to arbitrary vector path via `'path://'` in ECharts. As compared with a raster image, vector paths prevent jagging and blurring when scaled, and have better control over changing colors. The size of the vector icon will be adapted automatically. Refer to [SVG PathData](http://www.w3.org/TR/SVG/paths.html#PathData) for more information about the format of the path. You may export vector paths from tools like Adobe

For example:

```
'path://M30.9,53.2C16.8,53.2,5.3,41.7,5.3,27.6S16.8,2,30.9,2C45,2,56.4,13.5,56.4,27.6S45,53.2,30.9,53.2z M30.9,3.5C17.6,3.5,6.8,14.4,6.8,27.6c0,13.3,10.8,24.1,24.101,24.1C44.2,51.7,55,40.9,55,27.6C54.9,14.4,44.1,3.5,30.9,3.5z M36.9,35.8c0,0.601-0.4,1-0.9,1h-1.3c-0.5,0-0.9-0.399-0.9-1V19.5c0-0.6,0.4-1,0.9-1H36c0.5,0,0.9,0.4,0.9,1V35.8z M27.8,35.8 c0,0.601-0.4,1-0.9,1h-1.3c-0.5,0-0.9-0.399-0.9-1V19.5c0-0.6,0.4-1,0.9-1H27c0.5,0,0.9,0.4,0.9,1L27.8,35.8L27.8,35.8z'
```

name: symbolSize
desc: timeline symbol size. It can be set to single numbers like `10`, or use an array to represent width and height. For example, `[20, 10]` means symbol width is `20`, and height is`10`.

name: symbolRotate
desc: Rotate degree of timeline symbol. The negative value represents clockwise. Note that when `symbol` is set to be `'arrow'` in `markLine`, `symbolRotate` value will be ignored, and compulsively use tangent angle.

name: symbolKeepAspect
desc: Whether to keep aspect for symbols in the form of `path://`.

name: symbolOffset
desc:
Offset of timeline symbol relative to original position. By default, symbol will be put in the center position of data. But if symbol is from user-defined vector path or image, you may not expect symbol to be in center. In this case, you may use this attribute to set offset to default position. It can be in absolute pixel value, or in relative percentage value.

For example, `[0, '50%']` means to move upside side position of symbol height. It can be used to make the arrow in the bottom to be at data position when symbol is pin.

children.name: show
children.desc:
Whether to show the axis. It can be set to be `false` to hide the axis line to make a different style.



### color(Color)= '#304654'

timeline Line color.





> Color can be represented in RGB, for example `'rgb(128, 128, 128)'`. RGBA can be used when you need alpha channel, for example `'rgba(128, 128, 128, 0.5)'`. You may also use hexadecimal format, for example `'#ccc'`. Gradient color and texture are also supported besides single colors.
> ```js
> // Linear gradient. First four parameters are x0, y0, x2, and y2, each ranged from 0 to 1, standing for percentage in the bounding box. If global is `true`, then the first four parameters are in absolute pixel positions.
> color: {
>     type: 'linear',
>     x: 0,
>     y: 0,
>     x2: 0,
>     y2: 1,
>     colorStops: [{
>         offset: 0, color: 'red' // color at 0% position
>     }, {
>         offset: 1, color: 'blue' // color at 100% position
>     }],
>     global: false // false by default
> }
> // Radial gradient. First three parameters are x and y positions of center, and radius, similar to linear gradient.
> color: {
>     type: 'radial',
>     x: 0.5,
>     y: 0.5,
>     r: 0.5,
>     colorStops: [{
>         offset: 0, color: 'red' // color at 0% position
>     }, {
>         offset: 1, color: 'blue' // color at 100% position
>     }],
>     global: false // false by default
> }
> // Fill with texture
> color: {
>     image: imageDom, // HTMLImageElement, and HTMLCanvasElement are supported, while string path is not supported
>     repeat: 'repeat' // whether to repeat texture, whose value can be repeat-x, repeat-y, or no-repeat
> }
> ```

children.name: width
children.desc: timeline  line width.

children.name: type
children.desc:
timeline  line type.

Options are:
+ `'solid'`
+ `'dashed'`
+ `'dotted'`

children.name: shadowBlur
children.desc:
Size of shadow blur. This attribute should be used along with `shadowColor`,`shadowOffsetX`, `shadowOffsetY` to set shadow to component.

For example:
```js
{
shadowColor: 'rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.5)',
shadowBlur: 10
}
```

children.name: shadowColor
children.desc: Shadow color. Support same format as `color`.

children.name: shadowOffsetX
children.desc: Offset distance on the horizontal direction of shadow.

children.name: shadowOffsetY
children.desc: Offset distance on the vertical direction of shadow.

children.name: opacity
children.desc: Opacity of the component. Supports value from 0 to 1, and the component will not be drawn when set to 0.

name: label
desc: Label axis, `emphasis` is the highlighted style of text. For instance, text style in `emphasis` would be used when mouse hovers or legend connects.

children.name: position
children.desc:
Configurations:

+ `'auto'`:
Automatic layout.

+ `'left'`:
Put it along the left margin.
It is valid when [timline.orient](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#timeline.orient) is set as `'horizontal'` .

+ `'right'`:
Put it along the right margin.
It is valid when [timline.orient](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#timeline.orient) is set as `'horizontal'`.

+ `'top'`:
Put it along the margin of the top.
It is valid when [timline.orient](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#timeline.orient) is set as `'vertical'`.

+ `'bottom'`:
Put it along the margin of the bottom.
It is valid when [timline.orient](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#timeline.orient) is set as `'vertical'`.

+ `number`:
When it is assigned to be a a number value, it indicates the distance between `label` and axis. If it is set to be `0` , `label` would be at the same position with axis. Negative value is valid for the other side of the axis.

children.name: show
children.desc: Whether to show the label.

children.name: interval
children.desc: Interval of `label`. When it is assigned with a numerical value, such as  `2`, a label would show every 2 items.

children.name: rotate
children.desc: Rotation angle of `label`, in which positive values refer to counter clockwise rotation.

children.name: formatter
lineHeight
children.desc:
Line height of the text fragment.



If `lineHeight` is not set in `rich`, `lineHeight` in parent level will be used. For example:

```js
{
lineHeight: 56,
rich: {
a: {
// `lineHeight` is not set, then it will be 56
}
}
}
```




### backgroundColor(string|Object)='transparent'

Background color of the text fragment.

Can be color string, like `'#123234'`, `'red'`, `'rgba(0,23,11,0.3)'`.

Or image can be used, for example:

```js
backgroundColor: {
image: 'xxx/xxx.png'
// It can be URL of a image,
// or dataURI,
// or HTMLImageElement,
// or HTMLCanvasElement.
}
```

`width` or `height` can be specified when using background image, or
auto adapted by default.



### borderColor(Color)='transparent'

Border color of the text fragment.



### borderWidth(number)=0

Border width of the text fragment.

### borderRadius(number)=0

Border radius of the text fragment.

### padding(number|Array)=0

Padding of the text fragment, for example:

+ `padding: [3, 4, 5, 6]`: represents padding of `[top, right, bottom, left]`.
+ `padding: 4`: represents `padding: [4, 4, 4, 4]`.
+ `padding: [3, 4]`: represents `padding: [3, 4, 3, 4]`.

Notice, `width` and `height` specifies the width and height of the content, without `padding`.

### shadowColor(Color)='transparent'

Shadow color of the text block.

### shadowBlur(number)=0

Show blur of the text block.

### shadowOffsetX(number)=0

Shadow X offset of the text block.

### shadowOffsetY(number)=0

Shadow Y offset of the text block.

children.name: width
children.desc:
Width of the text block. It is the width of the text by default. In most cases, there is no need to specify it. You may want to use it in some cases like make simple table or using background image (see `backgroundColor`).

Notice, `width` and `height` specifies the width and height of the content, without `padding`.

`width` can also be percent string, like `'100%'`, which represents the percent of `contentWidth` (that is, the width without `padding`) of its container box. It is based on `contentWidth` because that each text fragment is layout based on the `content box`, where it makes no sense that calculating width based on `outerWith` in prectice.


Notice, `width` and `height` only work when `rich` specified.

children.name: height
children.desc:
Height of the text block. It is the width of the text by default. You may want to use it in some cases like using background image (see `backgroundColor`).

Notice, `width` and `height` specifies the width and height of the content, without `padding`.

Notice, `width` and `height` only work when `rich` specified.


### textBorderColor(Color)='transparent'

Storke color of the text.




### textBorderWidth(number)=0

Storke line width of the text.

### textShadowColor(Color)='transparent'

Shadow color of the text itself.

### textShadowBlur(number)=0

Shadow blue of the text itself.

### textShadowOffsetX(number)=0

Shadow X offset of the text itself.

### textShadowOffsetY(number)=0

Shadow Y offset of the text itself.

Notice, `width` and `height` specifies the width and height of the content, without `padding`.

Notice, `width` and `height` only work when `rich` specified.


###### textBorderColor(Color)='transparent'

Storke color of the text.




###### textBorderWidth(number)=0

Storke line width of the text.

###### textShadowColor(Color)='transparent'

Shadow color of the text itself.

###### textShadowBlur(number)=0

Shadow blue of the text itself.

###### textShadowOffsetX(number)=0

Shadow X offset of the text itself.

###### textShadowOffsetY(number)=0

Shadow Y offset of the text itself.

name: itemStyle
desc:
Graphic style of timeline , `emphasis` is the style when it is highlighted, like being hovered by mouse, or highlighted via legend connect.






### color(Color)='#304654'

timeline  color.



> Color can be represented in RGB, for example `'rgb(128, 128, 128)'`. RGBA can be used when you need alpha channel, for example `'rgba(128, 128, 128, 0.5)'`. You may also use hexadecimal format, for example `'#ccc'`. Gradient color and texture are also supported besides single colors.
> ```js
> // Linear gradient. First four parameters are x0, y0, x2, and y2, each ranged from 0 to 1, standing for percentage in the bounding box. If global is `true`, then the first four parameters are in absolute pixel positions.
> color: {
>     type: 'linear',
>     x: 0,
>     y: 0,
>     x2: 0,
>     y2: 1,
>     colorStops: [{
>         offset: 0, color: 'red' // color at 0% position
>     }, {
>         offset: 1, color: 'blue' // color at 100% position
>     }],
>     global: false // false by default
> }
> // Radial gradient. First three parameters are x and y positions of center, and radius, similar to linear gradient.
> color: {
>     type: 'radial',
>     x: 0.5,
>     y: 0.5,
>     r: 0.5,
>     colorStops: [{
>         offset: 0, color: 'red' // color at 0% position
>     }, {
>         offset: 1, color: 'blue' // color at 100% position
>     }],
>     global: false // false by default
> }
> // Fill with texture
> color: {
>     image: imageDom, // HTMLImageElement, and HTMLCanvasElement are supported, while string path is not supported
>     repeat: 'repeat' // whether to repeat texture, whose value can be repeat-x, repeat-y, or no-repeat
> }
> ```

children.name: shadowOffsetY

children.name: opacity

desc: Style of the selected item (`checkpoint`).

children.name: symbol
children.desc:
Symbol of timeline.checkpointStyle .



Icon types provided by ECharts includes
`'circle'`, `'rect'`, `'roundRect'`, `'triangle'`, `'diamond'`, `'pin'`, `'arrow'`, `'none'`






It can be set to an image with `'image://url'` , in which URL is the link to an image, or `dataURI` of an image.


An image URL example:

```
'image://http://xxx.xxx.xxx/a/b.png'
```

A `dataURI` example:

```
'image://data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhEAAQAMQAAORHHOVSKudfOulrSOp3WOyDZu6QdvCchPGolfO0o/XBs/fNwfjZ0frl3/zy7////wAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAACH5BAkAABAALAAAAAAQABAAAAVVICSOZGlCQAosJ6mu7fiyZeKqNKToQGDsM8hBADgUXoGAiqhSvp5QAnQKGIgUhwFUYLCVDFCrKUE1lBavAViFIDlTImbKC5Gm2hB0SlBCBMQiB0UjIQA7'
```


Icons can be set to arbitrary vector path via `'path://'` in ECharts. As compared with a raster image, vector paths prevent jagging and blurring when scaled, and have better control over changing colors. The size of the vector icon will be adapted automatically. Refer to [SVG PathData](http://www.w3.org/TR/SVG/paths.html#PathData) for more information about the format of the path. You may export vector paths from tools like Adobe

For example:

```
'path://M30.9,53.2C16.8,53.2,5.3,41.7,5.3,27.6S16.8,2,30.9,2C45,2,56.4,13.5,56.4,27.6S45,53.2,30.9,53.2z M30.9,3.5C17.6,3.5,6.8,14.4,6.8,27.6c0,13.3,10.8,24.1,24.101,24.1C44.2,51.7,55,40.9,55,27.6C54.9,14.4,44.1,3.5,30.9,3.5z M36.9,35.8c0,0.601-0.4,1-0.9,1h-1.3c-0.5,0-0.9-0.399-0.9-1V19.5c0-0.6,0.4-1,0.9-1H36c0.5,0,0.9,0.4,0.9,1V35.8z M27.8,35.8 c0,0.601-0.4,1-0.9,1h-1.3c-0.5,0-0.9-0.399-0.9-1V19.5c0-0.6,0.4-1,0.9-1H27c0.5,0,0.9,0.4,0.9,1L27.8,35.8L27.8,35.8z'
```

children.name: symbolSize
children.desc: timeline.checkpointStyle  symbol size. It can be set to single numbers like `10`, or use an array to represent width and height. For example, `[20, 10]` means symbol width is `20`, and height is`10`.

children.name: symbolRotate
children.desc: Rotate degree of timeline.checkpointStyle  symbol. The negative value represents clockwise. Note that when `symbol` is set to be `'arrow'` in `markLine`, `symbolRotate` value will be ignored, and compulsively use tangent angle.

children.name: symbolKeepAspect
children.desc: Whether to keep aspect for symbols in the form of `path://`.

children.name: symbolOffset
children.desc:
Offset of timeline.checkpointStyle  symbol relative to original position. By default, symbol will be put in the center position of data. But if symbol is from user-defined vector path or image, you may not expect symbol to be in center. In this case, you may use this attribute to set offset to default position. It can be in absolute pixel value, or in relative percentage value.

For example, `[0, '50%']` means to move upside side position of symbol height. It can be used to make the arrow in the bottom to be at data position when symbol is pin.

children.name: color
children.desc: Color of `checkpoint` in `timeline` component.

children.name: borderWidth
children.desc: The border-width of `checkpoint` in `timeline` component.

children.name: borderColor
children.desc: The border-color of `checkpoint` in `timeline` component.

children.name: animation
children.desc: In `timeline` component, whether there is animation in `checkpoint` moving during the process of `timeline` playing and switching.

children.name: animationDuration
children.desc: The animation duration of `checkpoint` in `timeline` component.

children.name: animationEasing
children.desc: The easing effect of animation of `checkpoint` in `timeline` component. Refers to [easing sample](https://echarts.apache.org/examples/en/view.html?c=line-easing) for different easing effects.

name: controlStyle
desc: The style of *control button*, which includes: *play button*, *previous button*, and *next button*.

children.name: show
children.desc: Whether to show control button. `false` for hide all.

children.name: showPlayBtn
children.desc: Whether to show play button.

children.name: showPrevBtn
children.desc: Whether to show previous button.

children.name: showNextBtn
children.desc: Whether to show next button.

children.name: itemSize
children.desc: Size of *control button*, in pixels (px).

children.name: itemGap
children.desc: Interval between *control button*, in pixels (px).

children.name: position
children.desc:
the location of *control button*.

+ When [timeline.orient](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#timeline.orient) is set to be `'horizontal'`, `'left'` and `'right'`are valid.

+ When [timeline.orient](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#timeline.orient) is set to be `'vertical'`, `'top'` and `'bottom'`are valid.

desc: `group` is the only type that can contain children, so that a group of elements can be positioned and transformed together.

Optional values:

children.name: id
children.desc:
id is used to specifying element when willing to update it.
id can be ignored if you do not need it.



### $action(string) = 'merge'

Specify the operation should be performed to the element when calling `setOption`.
Default value is 'merge', other values can be 'replace' or 'remove'.

Optional values:

+ `'merge'`: merge the given option to existing element (if any), otherwise create a new element.
+ `'replace'`: create a new element according to the given option and replace the existing element (if any).
+ `'remove'`: delete the existing element (if any).

children.name: position
children.desc:
`2D transform` can be applied to graphic elements, including:
+ [position](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#graphic.elements-polygon.position): `[horizontal translate offset, vertical translate offset]`, `[0, 0]` by default. Positive value means translate towards right or bottom.
+ [rotation](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#graphic.elements-polygon.rotation): Rotation in radian, `0` by default. Positive when anticlockwise.
+ [scale](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#graphic.elements-polygon.scale): `[horizontal scale factor, vertical scale factor]`, `[1, 1]` by default.

[origin](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#graphic.elements-polygon.origin) specifies the origin point of rotation and scaling, `[0, 0]` by default.

Notice:
+ The coordinates specified in the transform attribute above are relative to the `[0, 0]` of the parent element (that is, [group](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#graphic.elements-group) or the root canvas). Thus we are able to [group](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#graphic.elements-group) multiple elements, and [groups](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#graphic.elements-group) can be nested.
+ The order that the transform attributes are applied to a single graphic element is: Firstly, `rotation`, then, `scale`, finally, `position`.

children.name: rotation
children.desc:
`2D transform` can be applied to graphic elements, including:
+ [position](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#graphic.elements-polygon.position): `[horizontal translate offset, vertical translate offset]`, `[0, 0]` by default. Positive value means translate towards right or bottom.
+ [rotation](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#graphic.elements-polygon.rotation): Rotation in radian, `0` by default. Positive when anticlockwise.
+ [scale](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#graphic.elements-polygon.scale): `[horizontal scale factor, vertical scale factor]`, `[1, 1]` by default.

[origin](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#graphic.elements-polygon.origin) specifies the origin point of rotation and scaling, `[0, 0]` by default.

Notice:
+ The coordinates specified in the transform attribute above are relative to the `[0, 0]` of the parent element (that is, [group](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#graphic.elements-group) or the root canvas). Thus we are able to [group](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#graphic.elements-group) multiple elements, and [groups](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#graphic.elements-group) can be nested.
+ The order that the transform attributes are applied to a single graphic element is: Firstly, `rotation`, then, `scale`, finally, `position`.

children.name: left
children.desc:
Specify how to be positioned in its parent.

When the element is at the top level, the parent is the container of the chart instance.
Otherwise, the parent is a `group` element.

Optional values:

+ Pixel value: For example, can be a number `30`, means `30px`.
+ Percent value: For example, can be a string `'33%'`, means the final result should be calculated by this value and the width of its parent.
+ `'middle'`: means position the element in the middle of according to its parent.


Only one between [top](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#.polygon.top) and [bottom](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#.polygon.bottom) can work.

If [top](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#.polygon.top) or [bottom](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#.polygon.bottom) is specified, positioning attributes in [shape](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#.polygon.shape) (like `y`, `cy`) will not work.

children.name: bounding
children.desc:
Used to specify whether the entire transformed element (containing children if is group) is confined in its container.

See sample:
~[500x500](doc-example/graphic-bounding&edit=1&reset=1)

Optional values:

+ `'all'`: (default)
Use the transformed bounding box of itself and its descendants to perform position calculation, which confine the entire body in the boundary of its parent.

+ `'raw'`:
Only use the untransformed bounding box of itself (without its descentant) to perform position calculation, which is suitable when the content in the element need to be overflow its parent.

children.name: z
children.desc: z value of the elements, determine the overlap order.

children.name: zlevel
silent
children.desc: Whether response to mouse events / touch events.

children.name: invisible
children.desc: Whether the element is visible.

children.name: ignore
children.desc: Whether the element is totally ignored (neither render nor listen events).

children.name: cursor
children.desc: The mouse style when mouse hovers on an element, the same as `cursor` property in `CSS`.

children.name: draggable
children.desc: Can be dragged or not.

children.name: progressive
children.desc: Whether use progressive render to improve performance. Usually used when number of element is too large.

children.name: width
children.desc:
Specify width of this `group`.

This width is only used for the positioning of its children.

When width is `0`, children can also be positioned according to its parent using `left: 'center'`.

children.name: height
children.desc:
Specify height of this `group`.

This height is only used for the positioning of its children.

When height is `0`, children can also be positioned according to its parent using `top: 'middle'`.

children.name: diffChildrenByName
children.desc:
In [custom series](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#series-custom), when `diffChildrenByName` is set as `true`, for each [group](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#graphic.elements-group) returned from [renderItem](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#series-custom.renderItem), "diff" will be performed to its [children](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#graphic.elements-group.children) according to the [name](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#graphic.elements-polygon.name) attribute of each graphic elements. Here "diff" means that map the coming graphic elements to the existing graphic elements when repainting according to `name`, which enables the transition animation if data is modified.

But notice that the operation is performance consuming, do not use it for large data amount.

children.name: children
children.desc: A list of children, each item is a declaration of an element.

children.name: type
children.desc:
Must be specified when define a graphic element at the first time.

Optional values:


[image](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#graphic.elements-image),
[text](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#graphic.elements-text),
[circle](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#graphic.elements-circle),
[sector](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#graphic.elements-sector),
[ring](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#graphic.elements-ring),
[polygon](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#graphic.elements-polygon),
[polyline](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#graphic.elements-polyline),
[rect](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#graphic.elements-rect),
[line](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#graphic.elements-line),
[bezierCurve](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#graphic.elements-bezierCurve),
[arc](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#graphic.elements-arc),
[group](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#graphic.elements-group),

children.name: id
children.desc:
id is used to specifying element when willing to update it.
id can be ignored if you do not need it.



### $action(string) = 'merge'

Specify the operation should be performed to the element when calling `setOption`.
Default value is 'merge', other values can be 'replace' or 'remove'.

Optional values:

+ `'merge'`: merge the given option to existing element (if any), otherwise create a new element.
+ `'replace'`: create a new element according to the given option and replace the existing element (if any).
+ `'remove'`: delete the existing element (if any).

[origin](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#graphic.elements-polygon.origin) specifies the origin point of rotation and scaling, `[0, 0]` by default.

Notice:
+ The coordinates specified in the transform attribute above are relative to the `[0, 0]` of the parent element (that is, [group](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#graphic.elements-group) or the root canvas). Thus we are able to [group](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#graphic.elements-group) multiple elements, and [groups](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#graphic.elements-group) can be nested.
+ The order that the transform attributes are applied to a single graphic element is: Firstly, `rotation`, then, `scale`, finally, `position`.

children.name: left
children.desc:
Specify how to be positioned in its parent.

When the element is at the top level, the parent is the container of the chart instance.
Otherwise, the parent is a `group` element.

Optional values:

+ Pixel value: For example, can be a number `30`, means `30px`.
+ Percent value: For example, can be a string `'33%'`, means the final result should be calculated by this value and the width of its parent.
+ `'middle'`: means position the element in the middle of according to its parent.


Only one between [top](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#.polygon.top) and [bottom](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#.polygon.bottom) can work.

If [top](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#.polygon.top) or [bottom](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#.polygon.bottom) is specified, positioning attributes in [shape](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#.polygon.shape) (like `y`, `cy`) will not work.

children.name: bounding
children.desc:
Used to specify whether the entire transformed element (containing children if is group) is confined in its container.

See sample:
~[500x500](doc-example/graphic-bounding&edit=1&reset=1)

Optional values:

+ `'all'`: (default)
Use the transformed bounding box of itself and its descendants to perform position calculation, which confine the entire body in the boundary of its parent.

+ `'raw'`:
Only use the untransformed bounding box of itself (without its descentant) to perform position calculation, which is suitable when the content in the element need to be overflow its parent.

id is used to specifying element when willing to update it.

### $action(string) = 'merge'

Specify the operation should be performed to the element when calling `setOption`.
Default value is 'merge', other values can be 'replace' or 'remove'.

Optional values:

+ `'merge'`: merge the given option to existing element (if any), otherwise create a new element.
+ `'replace'`: create a new element according to the given option and replace the existing element (if any).
+ `'remove'`: delete the existing element (if any).

+ [rotation](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#graphic.elements-polygon.rotation): Rotation in radian, `0` by default. Positive when anticlockwise.
+ [scale](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#graphic.elements-polygon.scale): `[horizontal scale factor, vertical scale factor]`, `[1, 1]` by default.

[origin](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#graphic.elements-polygon.origin) specifies the origin point of rotation and scaling, `[0, 0]` by default.

Notice:
+ The coordinates specified in the transform attribute above are relative to the `[0, 0]` of the parent element (that is, [group](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#graphic.elements-group) or the root canvas). Thus we are able to [group](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#graphic.elements-group) multiple elements, and [groups](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#graphic.elements-group) can be nested.
+ The order that the transform attributes are applied to a single graphic element is: Firstly, `rotation`, then, `scale`, finally, `position`.

children.name: left
children.desc:
Specify how to be positioned in its parent.

When the element is at the top level, the parent is the container of the chart instance.
Otherwise, the parent is a `group` element.

Optional values:

+ Pixel value: For example, can be a number `30`, means `30px`.
+ Percent value: For example, can be a string `'33%'`, means the final result should be calculated by this value and the width of its parent.
+ `'middle'`: means position the element in the middle of according to its parent.


Only one between [top](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#.polygon.top) and [bottom](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#.polygon.bottom) can work.

If [top](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#.polygon.top) or [bottom](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#.polygon.bottom) is specified, positioning attributes in [shape](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#.polygon.shape) (like `y`, `cy`) will not work.

children.name: bounding
children.desc:
Used to specify whether the entire transformed element (containing children if is group) is confined in its container.

See sample:
~[500x500](doc-example/graphic-bounding&edit=1&reset=1)

Optional values:

+ `'all'`: (default)
Use the transformed bounding box of itself and its descendants to perform position calculation, which confine the entire body in the boundary of its parent.

+ `'raw'`:
Only use the untransformed bounding box of itself (without its descentant) to perform position calculation, which is suitable when the content in the element need to be overflow its parent.

children.name: z
children.desc: z value of the elements, determine the overlap order.

children.name: zlevel
silent
children.desc: Whether response to mouse events / touch events.

children.name: invisible
children.desc: Whether the element is visible.

children.name: ignore
children.desc: Whether the element is totally ignored (neither render nor listen events).

children.name: cursor
children.desc: The mouse style when mouse hovers on an element, the same as `cursor` property in `CSS`.

children.name: draggable
children.desc: Can be dragged or not.

children.name: progressive
children.desc: Whether use progressive render to improve performance. Usually used when number of element is too large.

children.name: x
children.desc: The x value of the left-top corner of the element in the coordinate system of its parent.

children.name: y
children.desc: The y value of the left-top corner of the element in the coordinate system of its parent.

children.name: width
children.desc: The width of the shape of the element.

children.name: height
children.desc: The height of the shape of the element.

children.name: r
children.desc:
Specify border radius of the rectangular here. Generally, `r` should be `[topLeftRadius, topRightRadius, BottomRightRadius, bottomLeftRadius]`, where each item is a number.

Abbreviation is enabled, for example:
+ `r`: `1`         means `[1, 1, 1, 1]`
+ `r`: `[1]`       means `[1, 1, 1, 1]`
+ `r`: `[1, 2]`    means `[1, 2, 1, 2]`
+ `r`: `[1, 2, 3]` means `[1, 2, 3, 2]`

children.name: style
children.desc:
More attributes in `style` (for example, [rich text](tutorial.html#Rich%20Text)), see the `style` related attributes in [zrender/graphic/Displayable](https://ecomfe.github.io/zrender-doc/public/api.html#zrenderdisplayable).

Notice, the attribute names of the `style` of graphic elements is derived from `zrender`, which may be different from the attribute names in `echarts label`, `echarts itemStyle`, etc., although they have the same meaning. For example:

+ [itemStyle.color](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#series-scatter.label.color) => `style.fill`
+ [itemStyle.borderColor](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#series-scatter.label.color) => `style.stroke`
+ [label.color](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#series-scatter.label.color) => `style.textFill`
+ [label.textBorderColor](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#series-scatter.label.textBorderColor) => `style.textStroke`
+ ...

children.name: id
children.desc:
id is used to specifying element when willing to update it.
id can be ignored if you do not need it.



### $action(string) = 'merge'

Specify the operation should be performed to the element when calling `setOption`.
Default value is 'merge', other values can be 'replace' or 'remove'.

Optional values:

+ `'merge'`: merge the given option to existing element (if any), otherwise create a new element.
+ `'replace'`: create a new element according to the given option and replace the existing element (if any).
+ `'remove'`: delete the existing element (if any).

+ [rotation](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#graphic.elements-polygon.rotation): Rotation in radian, `0` by default. Positive when anticlockwise.
+ [scale](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#graphic.elements-polygon.scale): `[horizontal scale factor, vertical scale factor]`, `[1, 1]` by default.

[origin](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#graphic.elements-polygon.origin) specifies the origin point of rotation and scaling, `[0, 0]` by default.

Notice:
+ The coordinates specified in the transform attribute above are relative to the `[0, 0]` of the parent element (that is, [group](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#graphic.elements-group) or the root canvas). Thus we are able to [group](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#graphic.elements-group) multiple elements, and [groups](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#graphic.elements-group) can be nested.
+ The order that the transform attributes are applied to a single graphic element is: Firstly, `rotation`, then, `scale`, finally, `position`.

children.name: left
children.desc:
Specify how to be positioned in its parent.

When the element is at the top level, the parent is the container of the chart instance.
Otherwise, the parent is a `group` element.

Optional values:

+ Pixel value: For example, can be a number `30`, means `30px`.
+ Percent value: For example, can be a string `'33%'`, means the final result should be calculated by this value and the width of its parent.
+ `'middle'`: means position the element in the middle of according to its parent.


Only one between [top](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#.polygon.top) and [bottom](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#.polygon.bottom) can work.

If [top](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#.polygon.top) or [bottom](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#.polygon.bottom) is specified, positioning attributes in [shape](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#.polygon.shape) (like `y`, `cy`) will not work.

children.name: bounding
children.desc:
Used to specify whether the entire transformed element (containing children if is group) is confined in its container.

See sample:
~[500x500](doc-example/graphic-bounding&edit=1&reset=1)

Optional values:

+ `'all'`: (default)
Use the transformed bounding box of itself and its descendants to perform position calculation, which confine the entire body in the boundary of its parent.

+ `'raw'`:
Only use the untransformed bounding box of itself (without its descentant) to perform position calculation, which is suitable when the content in the element need to be overflow its parent.

children.name: style
children.desc:
More attributes in `style` (for example, [rich text](tutorial.html#Rich%20Text)), see the `style` related attributes in [zrender/graphic/Displayable](https://ecomfe.github.io/zrender-doc/public/api.html#zrenderdisplayable).

Notice, the attribute names of the `style` of graphic elements is derived from `zrender`, which may be different from the attribute names in `echarts label`, `echarts itemStyle`, etc., although they have the same meaning. For example:

+ [itemStyle.color](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#series-scatter.label.color) => `style.fill`
+ [itemStyle.borderColor](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#series-scatter.label.color) => `style.stroke`
+ [label.color](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#series-scatter.label.color) => `style.textFill`
+ [label.textBorderColor](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#series-scatter.label.textBorderColor) => `style.textStroke`
+ ...

children.name: id
children.desc:
id is used to specifying element when willing to update it.
id can be ignored if you do not need it.



### $action(string) = 'merge'

Specify the operation should be performed to the element when calling `setOption`.
Default value is 'merge', other values can be 'replace' or 'remove'.

Optional values:

+ `'merge'`: merge the given option to existing element (if any), otherwise create a new element.
+ `'replace'`: create a new element according to the given option and replace the existing element (if any).
+ `'remove'`: delete the existing element (if any).

children.name: id
children.desc:
id is used to specifying element when willing to update it.
id can be ignored if you do not need it.



### $action(string) = 'merge'

Specify the operation should be performed to the element when calling `setOption`.
Default value is 'merge', other values can be 'replace' or 'remove'.

Optional values:

+ `'merge'`: merge the given option to existing element (if any), otherwise create a new element.
+ `'replace'`: create a new element according to the given option and replace the existing element (if any).
+ `'remove'`: delete the existing element (if any).

children.name: position
children.desc:
`2D transform` can be applied to graphic elements, including:
+ [position](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#graphic.elements-polygon.position): `[horizontal translate offset, vertical translate offset]`, `[0, 0]` by default. Positive value means translate towards right or bottom.
+ [rotation](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#graphic.elements-polygon.rotation): Rotation in radian, `0` by default. Positive when anticlockwise.
+ [scale](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#graphic.elements-polygon.scale): `[horizontal scale factor, vertical scale factor]`, `[1, 1]` by default.

[origin](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#graphic.elements-polygon.origin) specifies the origin point of rotation and scaling, `[0, 0]` by default.

Notice:
+ The coordinates specified in the transform attribute above are relative to the `[0, 0]` of the parent element (that is, [group](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#graphic.elements-group) or the root canvas). Thus we are able to [group](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#graphic.elements-group) multiple elements, and [groups](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#graphic.elements-group) can be nested.
+ The order that the transform attributes are applied to a single graphic element is: Firstly, `rotation`, then, `scale`, finally, `position`.

children.name: left
children.desc:
Specify how to be positioned in its parent.

When the element is at the top level, the parent is the container of the chart instance.
Otherwise, the parent is a `group` element.

Optional values:

+ Pixel value: For example, can be a number `30`, means `30px`.
+ Percent value: For example, can be a string `'33%'`, means the final result should be calculated by this value and the width of its parent.
+ `'middle'`: means position the element in the middle of according to its parent.


Only one between [top](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#.polygon.top) and [bottom](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#.polygon.bottom) can work.

If [top](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#.polygon.top) or [bottom](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#.polygon.bottom) is specified, positioning attributes in [shape](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#.polygon.shape) (like `y`, `cy`) will not work.

children.name: bounding
children.desc:
Used to specify whether the entire transformed element (containing children if is group) is confined in its container.

See sample:
~[500x500](doc-example/graphic-bounding&edit=1&reset=1)

Optional values:

+ `'all'`: (default)
Use the transformed bounding box of itself and its descendants to perform position calculation, which confine the entire body in the boundary of its parent.

+ `'raw'`:
Only use the untransformed bounding box of itself (without its descentant) to perform position calculation, which is suitable when the content in the element need to be overflow its parent.

children.desc: z value of the elements, determine the overlap order.

children.name: zlevel
silent
children.desc: Whether response to mouse events / touch events.

children.name: invisible
children.desc: Whether the element is visible.

children.name: ignore
children.desc: Whether the element is totally ignored (neither render nor listen events).

children.name: cursor
children.desc: The mouse style when mouse hovers on an element, the same as `cursor` property in `CSS`.

children.name: draggable
children.desc: Can be dragged or not.

children.name: progressive

children.desc: The x value of the center of the element in the coordinate system of its parent.

children.name: cy
children.desc: The y value of the center of the element in the coordinate system of its parent.

children.name: r
children.desc: Outside radius.

children.name: r0
children.desc: Inside radius.

children.desc: start angle, in radian.

children.name: endAngle
children.desc: end anble, in radian.

children.name: clockwise

children.name: style
children.desc:
More attributes in `style` (for example, [rich text](tutorial.html#Rich%20Text)), see the `style` related attributes in [zrender/graphic/Displayable](https://ecomfe.github.io/zrender-doc/public/api.html#zrenderdisplayable).

Notice, the attribute names of the `style` of graphic elements is derived from `zrender`, which may be different from the attribute names in `echarts label`, `echarts itemStyle`, etc., although they have the same meaning. For example:

+ [itemStyle.color](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#series-scatter.label.color) => `style.fill`
+ [itemStyle.borderColor](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#series-scatter.label.color) => `style.stroke`
+ [label.color](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#series-scatter.label.color) => `style.textFill`
+ [label.textBorderColor](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#series-scatter.label.textBorderColor) => `style.textStroke`
+ ...

### $action(string) = 'merge'

Specify the operation should be performed to the element when calling `setOption`.
Default value is 'merge', other values can be 'replace' or 'remove'.

Optional values:

+ `'merge'`: merge the given option to existing element (if any), otherwise create a new element.
+ `'replace'`: create a new element according to the given option and replace the existing element (if any).
+ `'remove'`: delete the existing element (if any).

children.name: position
children.desc:
`2D transform` can be applied to graphic elements, including:
+ [position](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#graphic.elements-polygon.position): `[horizontal translate offset, vertical translate offset]`, `[0, 0]` by default. Positive value means translate towards right or bottom.
+ [rotation](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#graphic.elements-polygon.rotation): Rotation in radian, `0` by default. Positive when anticlockwise.
+ [scale](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#graphic.elements-polygon.scale): `[horizontal scale factor, vertical scale factor]`, `[1, 1]` by default.

[origin](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#graphic.elements-polygon.origin) specifies the origin point of rotation and scaling, `[0, 0]` by default.

Notice:
+ The coordinates specified in the transform attribute above are relative to the `[0, 0]` of the parent element (that is, [group](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#graphic.elements-group) or the root canvas). Thus we are able to [group](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#graphic.elements-group) multiple elements, and [groups](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#graphic.elements-group) can be nested.
+ The order that the transform attributes are applied to a single graphic element is: Firstly, `rotation`, then, `scale`, finally, `position`.

children.name: left
children.desc:
Specify how to be positioned in its parent.

When the element is at the top level, the parent is the container of the chart instance.
Otherwise, the parent is a `group` element.

Optional values:

+ Pixel value: For example, can be a number `30`, means `30px`.
+ Percent value: For example, can be a string `'33%'`, means the final result should be calculated by this value and the width of its parent.
+ `'middle'`: means position the element in the middle of according to its parent.


Only one between [top](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#.polygon.top) and [bottom](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#.polygon.bottom) can work.

If [top](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#.polygon.top) or [bottom](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#.polygon.bottom) is specified, positioning attributes in [shape](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#.polygon.shape) (like `y`, `cy`) will not work.

children.name: bounding
children.desc:
Used to specify whether the entire transformed element (containing children if is group) is confined in its container.

See sample:
~[500x500](doc-example/graphic-bounding&edit=1&reset=1)

Optional values:

+ `'all'`: (default)
Use the transformed bounding box of itself and its descendants to perform position calculation, which confine the entire body in the boundary of its parent.

+ `'raw'`:
Only use the untransformed bounding box of itself (without its descentant) to perform position calculation, which is suitable when the content in the element need to be overflow its parent.

children.name: z
children.desc: z value of the elements, determine the overlap order.

children.name: zlevel
silent
children.desc: Whether response to mouse events / touch events.

children.name: invisible
children.desc: Whether the element is visible.

children.name: ignore
children.desc: Whether the element is totally ignored (neither render nor listen events).

children.name: cursor
children.desc: The mouse style when mouse hovers on an element, the same as `cursor` property in `CSS`.

children.name: draggable
children.desc: Can be dragged or not.

children.name: progressive
children.desc: Whether use progressive render to improve performance. Usually used when number of element is too large.

children.name: points
children.desc: A list of points, which defines the shape, like `[[22, 44], [44, 55], [11, 44], ...]`.

children.name: smooth
children.desc:
Whether smooth the line.

+ If the value is number, bezier interpolation is used, and the value specified the level of smooth, which is in the range of `[0, 1]`.
+ If the value is `'spline'`, Catmull-Rom spline interpolation is used.

children.name: smoothConstraint
children.desc:
Whether prevent the smooth process cause the line out of the bounding box.

Only works when `smooth` is `number` (bezier smooth).

children.name: style
children.desc:
More attributes in `style` (for example, [rich text](tutorial.html#Rich%20Text)), see the `style` related attributes in [zrender/graphic/Displayable](https://ecomfe.github.io/zrender-doc/public/api.html#zrenderdisplayable).

Notice, the attribute names of the `style` of graphic elements is derived from `zrender`, which may be different from the attribute names in `echarts label`, `echarts itemStyle`, etc., although they have the same meaning. For example:

+ [itemStyle.color](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#series-scatter.label.color) => `style.fill`
+ [itemStyle.borderColor](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#series-scatter.label.color) => `style.stroke`
+ [label.color](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#series-scatter.label.color) => `style.textFill`
+ [label.textBorderColor](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#series-scatter.label.textBorderColor) => `style.textStroke`
+ ...

Notice, the attribute names of the `style` of graphic elements is derived from `zrender`, which may be different from the attribute names in `echarts label`, `echarts itemStyle`, etc., although they have the same meaning. For example:

+ [itemStyle.color](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#series-scatter.label.color) => `style.fill`
+ [itemStyle.borderColor](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#series-scatter.label.color) => `style.stroke`
+ [label.color](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#series-scatter.label.color) => `style.textFill`
+ [label.textBorderColor](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#series-scatter.label.textBorderColor) => `style.textStroke`
+ ...

children.name: id
children.desc:
id is used to specifying element when willing to update it.
id can be ignored if you do not need it.



### $action(string) = 'merge'

Specify the operation should be performed to the element when calling `setOption`.
Default value is 'merge', other values can be 'replace' or 'remove'.

Optional values:

+ `'merge'`: merge the given option to existing element (if any), otherwise create a new element.
+ `'replace'`: create a new element according to the given option and replace the existing element (if any).
+ `'remove'`: delete the existing element (if any).

children.name: position
children.desc:
`2D transform` can be applied to graphic elements, including:
+ [position](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#graphic.elements-polygon.position): `[horizontal translate offset, vertical translate offset]`, `[0, 0]` by default. Positive value means translate towards right or bottom.
+ [rotation](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#graphic.elements-polygon.rotation): Rotation in radian, `0` by default. Positive when anticlockwise.
+ [scale](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#graphic.elements-polygon.scale): `[horizontal scale factor, vertical scale factor]`, `[1, 1]` by default.

[origin](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#graphic.elements-polygon.origin) specifies the origin point of rotation and scaling, `[0, 0]` by default.

Notice:
+ The coordinates specified in the transform attribute above are relative to the `[0, 0]` of the parent element (that is, [group](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#graphic.elements-group) or the root canvas). Thus we are able to [group](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#graphic.elements-group) multiple elements, and [groups](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#graphic.elements-group) can be nested.
+ The order that the transform attributes are applied to a single graphic element is: Firstly, `rotation`, then, `scale`, finally, `position`.

children.name: left
children.desc:
Specify how to be positioned in its parent.

When the element is at the top level, the parent is the container of the chart instance.
Otherwise, the parent is a `group` element.

Optional values:

+ Pixel value: For example, can be a number `30`, means `30px`.
+ Percent value: For example, can be a string `'33%'`, means the final result should be calculated by this value and the width of its parent.
+ `'middle'`: means position the element in the middle of according to its parent.


Only one between [top](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#.polygon.top) and [bottom](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#.polygon.bottom) can work.

If [top](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#.polygon.top) or [bottom](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#.polygon.bottom) is specified, positioning attributes in [shape](https://echarts.apache.org/en/option.html#.polygon.shape) (like `y`, `cy`) will not work.

children.name: bounding
children.desc:
Used to specify whether the entire transformed element (containing children if is group) is confined in its container.

See sample:
~[500x500](doc-example/graphic-bounding&edit=1&reset=1)

Optional values:

+ `'all'`: (default)
Use the transformed bounding box of itself and its descendants to perform position calculation, which confine the entire body in the boundary of its parent.

+ `'raw'`:
Only use the untransformed bounding box of itself (without its descentant) to perform position calculation, which is suitable when the content in the element need to be overflow its parent.

x of the second control point. If specified, cubic bezier is used.

If both `cpx2` and `cpy2` are not set, quatratic bezier is used.

children.name: cpy2
children.desc:
y of the second control point. If specified, cubic bezier is used.

If both `cpx2` and `cpy2` are not set, quatratic bezier is used.

Value range: [0, 1].
